item.title: Do Not Panic Over 2% Bitcoin Price Dip After The Halving
item.description:
Do Not Panic Over 2% Bitcoin Price Dip After The Halving

Comparing this minor 2% price dip to the Bitcoin price over the course of the past few years, it is a small blip on the radar. Volatility has been kept to a minimum during this milestone event. Now that the Bitcoin halving is behind us, the community can breathe a sense of relief.

item.title: Coinapult Enables 300 Bitcoin Kiosks in Colombia
item.description:
Coinapult Enables 300 Bitcoin Kiosks in Colombia

Bitcoin wallet and services provider Coinapult has revealed an integration with Punto Pago, a kiosk operator, which will see 300 kiosks now sell bitcoin to Colombians across the country. Panamanian startup Coinapult, co-founded by Erik Vorhees in 2012 and headquartered in Panama City has announced a new development which will see bitcoin buying made easier in Colombia.

item.title: YoCoin: The Bitcoin Alternative | PYMNTS.com
item.description:
YoCoin: The Bitcoin Alternative | PYMNTS.com

There's another digital currency in town, and its name is YoCoin. The question is: Can YoCoin give bitcoin a run for its money? We'll have to wait and see. But YoCoin is pitching itself as a "new cryptocurrency with mainstream appeal."

item.title: ARK's Chris Burniske And Coinbase's Adam White On Bitcoin And Cryptocurrencies As An Asset Class
item.description:
ARK's Chris Burniske And Coinbase's Adam White On Bitcoin And Cryptocurrencies As An Asset Class

Invest in oil and gold? In this episode of the Unchained podcast, the co-authors of a compelling white paper explain why you may soon be investing in digital oil and digital gold instead.

item.title: Largest Swedish Gold Dealer Has Bank Accounts Closed: Time for Bitcoin?
item.description:
Largest Swedish Gold Dealer Has Bank Accounts Closed: Time for Bitcoin?

Last month, Sweden's largest precious metal dealer posted a notice that their bank account had been closed without their consent. Tavex Guld & Valuta posted a notice on June 30th that their bank account had been unilaterally closed. This left the dealer without an efficient way of accepting payments for good, racing to establish a new payment system.

item.title: Kim Dotcom Hints At Bitcoin Service To Launch In 2017
item.description:
Kim Dotcom Hints At Bitcoin Service To Launch In 2017

There seems to be a lot of speculation going on as to what Kim Dotcom is up to these days. Everyone is well aware of how he has a soft spot for Bitcoin. But he hasn't given up on his dreams to create a proper file sharing solution either.

item.title: Siamining - Another Open Public Siacoin (SC) GPU Mining Pool
item.description:
Siamining - Another Open Public Siacoin (SC) GPU Mining Pool

A few days ago we've covered the beta SIA pool from Nanopool, and now there is a second more interesting SIacoin mining pool open for public already available called Siamining.

item.title: Philippines Customers Can Pay Consumer Loans, Bills With Bitcoin
item.description:
Philippines Customers Can Pay Consumer Loans, Bills With Bitcoin

Philippines-based bitcoin services company Coins.ph now allows its users to repay consumer loans with bitcoin - increasing the number of products Filipinos can buy with digital currency. Also read: Bitcoin Making Inroads into Rural Philippines with WiFi Hotspots Coins.ph is providing the payment gateway for local consumer finance company Home Credit.

item.title: Bitcoin wallet Plutus raises over $1M in crowdsale - EconoTimes
item.description:
Bitcoin wallet Plutus raises over $1M in crowdsale - EconoTimes

Digital Currency Bitcoin wallet Plutus raises over $1M in crowdsale Monday, July 11, 2016 12:35 PM UTC Plutus, a mobile bitcoin wallet for making in-store purchases at Near Field Communication (NFC) terminals, has announced that it raised more than one million dollars in nine days, in a flash crowdsale.

item.title: Mijin Blockchain Completes Microfinance Data Transfer Test
item.description:
Mijin Blockchain Completes Microfinance Data Transfer Test

It is positive to see this experiment being completed successfully. There have been some questions regarding the scalability of blockchain solutions in the financial sector. Mijin can handle close to 100,000 transactions per second, making it more suitable for transfers taking place in quick succession. Blockchain technology has been captivating audiences all over the world.
